title: How to Install a Sliding Bolt

steps.title: Gather all the Things You'll Need.
steps.content: Gather all the Things You'll Need.

steps.title: Choose a height for your sliding bolt.
steps.content: Choose a height for your sliding bolt. Measure and mark it in two places to ensure that the bolt is level.

steps.title: Align the main body of the bolt with your pencil marks and mark the position of the screw holes.
steps.content: Align the main body of the bolt with your pencil marks and mark the position of the screw holes.

steps.title: Drill a shallow hole on each of your screw hole pencil marks.
steps.content: Drill a shallow hole on each of your screw hole pencil marks. These pilot holes will make it easier to drill in the screws.

steps.title: Change the drill bit to a screw head bit.
steps.content: Change the drill bit to a screw head bit. Hold the main body of the bolt over your pilot holes and drill into position.

steps.title: Hold the staple against the door frame, level with the bolt.
steps.content: Hold the staple against the door frame, level with the bolt. Draw around it with your pencil. Now you need to chisel out a shallow recess for the bolt holder.

steps.title: Make a series of deep cuts along your pencil outline.
steps.content: Make a series of deep cuts along your pencil outline.

steps.title: Check the fit of the bolt holder in the recess.
steps.content: Check the fit of the bolt holder in the recess. Mark the position of the screw holes.

steps.title: Attach a narrow bit to the drill and drill some pilot holes, then fit a screw head bit and drill the staple into the recess.
steps.content: Attach a narrow bit to the drill and drill some pilot holes, then fit a screw head bit and drill the staple into the recess.
